title: [Self-Directed] VR-Based Ecological Dynamics Theory Program for Improving Sports Language Communication Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic sports science knowledge, VR technology experience, foundational communication skills in sports contexts (commands, questions, encouragement), and basic grammar and sports-related vocabulary
context.additional_context: Building personalized sports training environments using digital devices and strengthening real-time linguistic decision-making skills through ecological dynamics theory. Trains effective team communication (integrating listening, speaking, nonverbal expression) with a focus on comprehensively developing learners' expressive skills, reading comprehension, and context-appropriate language use.

learning_goals: Design personalized training scenarios using VR systems and execute verbal communication strategies (commands, feedback, encouragement) within teams.

Enhance real-time verbal decision-making (commands, feedback, encouragement) in response to environmental changes based on ecological dynamics theory, applying sport-contextual vocabulary and grammatical structures.

Learners explore ≥10 problem scenarios in VR/simulation platforms, design ≥3 creative language strategies (context-specific expressions, nonverbal integration, strategic questioning) suitable for sports contexts, and apply them with ≥80% success rate in actual game situations.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
